meanings.definition: A member of a traditionally itinerant ethnic group living in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: The tziganes traveled from place to place in search of new opportunities.
meanings.sent2: I met a group of tziganes at the market selling handmade crafts.
meanings.sent3: The tziganes decided to set up camp in the park for the night, much to the surprise of the locals.
meanings.sent4: Her free spirit and wanderlust made her feel like a tziganes in her own right.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clothes and lively music of the tziganes left a lasting impression on the town.

meanings.definition: The language of the Tziganes, a form of Romani.
meanings.sent1: Learning to speak tziganes was a challenging but rewarding experience.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the melodic tones of tziganes being spoken in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to try and mimic the sounds of tziganes without understanding the words.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed like tziganes, captivating everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ancient songs sung in tziganes echoed through the valley, enchanting all who listened.
